Hello WAVE.
I am requesting two new billing categories. One for residential, and one for very small business; 100MB or less for both, at an affordable rate for those that rely on the internet for personal , and business. 
As the founder/CEO of my nonprofit; www.fymhs.org , I find your business rates too high today. I am a person on disability making good use of the time I have to use, and pay it forward. No salary ever for the nonprofit work, and little to just pay the mortgage and no frills.
I have been a residential customer for 4 years, and this month, with average usage of data under 100MG always, I am shocked to have a rate of $50.60 per month, and not the under $30. that I had before this month. It should be no more than $25. including tax for those  two categories, and possibly less for low income persons that meet the federal guidelines. I do, but you have no help.  I will reach a point where I can no longer, in good stewardship, pay for internet, and that will be a struggle finding access to check email, and attend seminars to increase my knowledge to help others.
The purpose of what I do is to provide evidence based nutrition for families to avoid type 2 diabetes. I am currently working on a federal health care submission to the USPFTF so we can step closer to wellness care.
I cannot ask for any federal or state assistance since I believe those dollars must go to those organizations that feed and house people in need at this difficult time.
The internet is an important tool for those working to accomplish great changes for ALL people, including you.
What are you willing to do in these circumstances? Remember, more people will remember those big corporations that found some heart and changed policies during hard times with favor than those that stayed with policies that border greed.
I await a response from your corporate officers, #haroldazeitz , #timklinefelter, #patrickknorr, #jtaylorcrandall, #jonathanefriesel, #scottabaker .
Thank you.

Mr. Weed (CEO Wave Broadband)

I am writing this message to request your company‚Äôs assistance on addressing an ever-growing situation with your companies Internet service in the city of Hubbard.  As you know a steady consistent internet service is mandatory these days with CDL (comprehensive distance learning) and many professions now having to work from home.

Since a power outage that occurred on Tuesday Feb 2nd, 2021 the QoS delivered to Hubbard has suffered greatly, with many reporting a similar situation (constant dropping and reconnecting of service).  Since the power was brought back online after the Feb 12th, 2021 Ice Storm, and internet service from Wave was slowly restored to many residents, I am hearing even more reports of this drop/reconnect issue.  Wave delivered an acceptance QoS to Hubbard prior to Feb 2nd, 2021, at which time something has occurred to a critical piece of your infrastructure that is causing issues in many parts of Hubbard.   

As of Monday evening, these drops became so bad that I started logging (via a connection monitor) how many drops occurred in a 24-hr period.  I reset this log yesterday, after one of your Support Techs came out and ran a new cable from the power pole to my home and installed a new modem.  Since 12:06 PM yesterday my personal service has now recorded a total of 439 disconnects with only a 41% availability since 12:06 yesterday.  

At this point, with many now reporting similar issues across Hubbard, your service is impacting the ability of children to attend class online (many parents are restoring to purchasing Hotspots for internet connections via cell service) or have forgone having their children attend class.
I am writing this letter to both inform you of the plight your internet QoS is having on Hubbard, but also to implore your company to address whatever infrastructure issue is preventing our city from having a continuous internet connection.

Sincerely,

Charles Rostocil
Mayor of Hubbard Oregon
I will continue to post this urgent request to improve QoS until action is taken...

Today we headed out to get project photos and updates on what‚Äôs happening! They are just about done with all internal electrical work and will begin working on outside lighting in the coming weeks! We had some powerhouse women join us on International Women's Day as we announced our plans for our next big Women Build! 

Huge thanks to Executive Director for the Sacramento Housing and Redevelopment Agency, La Shelle Dozier who shared about the critical need for more affordable housing, the role affordable housing plays in equity building, and the importance of advocating for more resources for affordable housing solutions. We were also joined by a panel of amazing Women Build champions who jumped online to share about their Women Build experiences and passions for building a stronger community. 

Interested in learning more about how you or your organization can be part of our upcoming Women Build? Email our Community Engagement Officer Kaitlyn Bathke at KBathke@HabitatGreaterSac.org or visit HabitatGreaterSac.org/womenbuild 
#WomenBuildSac 

Thanks to Tia Gemmell for snapping these webinar photos and for Lowe's Home Improvement for their support of Women Build worldwide in over 300 communities this year! 

Lowe‚Äôs and Wave are our first official partners for Women Build 2022!
#BuildHer #WomenBuild

I have had problem after problem with this company with person after person.  Promises made and not kept.  The list is too long to include everything, but here are a few recent and ongoing examples.

I wanted to add phone service for my 102-year-old grandmother, but didn't want anybody in the house because of Covid.  The sales person told me I had to go to a store (30 minutes away) to get the modem.  But when I got to the store I was told they don't have equipment in store.  All said, it took me 4 hours with customer service on the phone to arrange equipment be delivered just to get new phone service (and it did not require a technician to install).

Over a year ago, they told me they needed to "drop a new line" to get my service quality up to what I'm paying for.  Every time I call them to schedule that I get put on hold for 45 minutes, they make promise after promise that the "right people" will be notified and somebody will call me back the next day.  And I never hear from anybody.  Ever.  I know they have my phone number, because they recognize my account when I call them.  I know they have my email, because they never miss sending me a bill.  They don't even claim they've tried to reach me or schedule an appointment.  But the "construction" team apparently is a black hole that never reads messages or tickets.  I've called during normal hours and during off hours.  I've asked to speak to supervisors and managers and their managers.  Everybody makes a promise and not a single one of them has been kept.
Wifi just disconnected tried to restart everything and nothing works

Today in: Technical Troubleshooting Trivia 

We have two very old (2010) Mac minis. One was in use at our previous house, hooked up to our tv set, so we could watch Amazon Prime and iTunes videos.

The other, I purchased to use at a contract that, sadly (or perhaps for the best) didn't last more than a week until I "resigned".

So, Mini #1 was updated to a relatively recent version of Mac OS X (10.12) but Mini #2 was still running the original OS (10.6).

I decided to hook Mini #2 up. 
   - cables? check
   - boots? check
   - log in? check
   - network? 
      network???

Back in the days of 10.6, "Wi-Fi" was called "Airport". And, for whatever 11-yr-old reason, this OS doesn't want to talk to our current WPA2 Wi-Fi.

It varied between telling me my password was invalid (it wasn't; I even made the password visible to ensure it was typed correctly) and telling me to contact my admin (as I am "my admin", this was not helpful. There was no specific or helpful information to _give_ "my admin").

"OK," I thought, "I can work around this."

I carried the Mini downstairs to the shelf where the router/modem is. I plugged it directly into the Ethernet cable that's plugged into the back of the router.

Nothing.

I called Wave. I asked if there was some setting I needed to apply to make wired Ethernet work.

Nope.

I tried the other Mini,
Nope.

I plugged the Ethernet cable into an E-net-to-USB adaptor and tried one of our laptops.

Hmmmm... No network connection.

Maybe it's a bad cable??

We, (being us), have plenty of Ethernet cables. Also, we've managed to unpack enough of the boxes we moved with to be able to _find_ one of those Ethernet cables.

Cable-to-adaptor in laptop? check
Cable in Mini? Check! 

We Can Haz Internet!

Downloading Mac OS X 10.11 installer: check!
Upgrading: check
Downloading Mac OS X 10.12 installer*: check!
   * yes, it really needed to be a 2-step process
Upgrading: check!

==
One might ask why I wanted to upgrade an 11-year-old Mac mini.

a) because it still runs
b) because it has a CD/DVD drive
c) because, if I decide to rehome it, I want to know it can reach the Internet
d) because not being able to talk to the 'Net was annoying me. (An old computer has some value. An old computer with an old OS that can't get on the 'Net is a brick.)

Today we heard from #DEI experts Diem Ly of @comcast, Priya Frank of @iheartSAM, and Kevin Henry of @SoundMH on how to commit organizations to diversity, equity, and inclusion work at our #Recalibrate Symposium https://t.co/udLIHHS4B3

If your org has not yet invested in the emotional intelligence of its employees, it's time to do that. Start with that first. If you don't have that as a foundation for people to have a safe place to have these conversations, it'll go awry. - Diem Ly, @comcast #Recalibrate

It requires a courageous culture & confident leadership. It has to be modelled & reinforced. It has to imbedded in your mission & business practices. It requires a lot of humility too. - Diem Ly, @comcast #Recalibrate

There's a strong desire to want to go tactical before getting to the purpose & the why. Don't forget to focus on the why and tie it back into your mission & your operating principles as an organization. - Diem Ly, @comcast #Recalibrate
It's values that you build into the culture. You build the case for it and over time you can get the buy in from leadership and the budget and capacity needed. - Diem Ly, @comcast #Recalibrate

A lot of times it's employee driven. It starts with highly engaged employees with no budget. Spending their own time to transform the culture, then bring it back to the organization's mission, and present it to leadership and ask for budget. - Diem Ly, @comcast #Recalibrate

Giving people the opportunity to self-select different materials depending on what resonates with them & where they are in the journey. Carve out time where people can reflect. Taking time out of the business to invest in this is a big deal. - Diem Ly, @comcast #Recalibrate

Assess where you're at so far. Look at your vendors & volunteer opportunities. Look at your own business practices & your policies. Look at them through a fresh lens. Form a group of engaged employees & see where it goes from there. - Diem Ly, @comcast #Recalibrate
